fore doue holie ghost holie ghost doue otherwise angel may haue taught enter indeed body made read angel spake asse bala diuell serpent talked eue present dispute kinde onelie saie angel working therewithall perfourme thing figured except truth performaunce thing went ioyntlie signe vnproper speach say baptime washing soule waie must beware put ouer thing either signe minister signe proper god onelie saie thinke minister author washing v cleane water purge filthinesse soule doe belongeth onelie vnto christ bloud againe must take heede peece trust stick either water man much onelie right vse sacrament leade v straightlie hande vnto christ staie onelie holie ghost renueth quickeneth v creature outward worke able bring passe circumcision doe nothing auaile christ gal surelie neither auaileth anie man bee onelie dipt water admitted church except haue faith workefull charitie thing powring water perfourmeth bee baptised faithfull therefore added word marl vpon apoc fol baptime bringeth grace example followe baptime bringeth grace itact doth appeare simon sorcerer tindale phee hath put christ saith saint hierome hath onelie receiued washing water except also hee receiue holie ghost symon magus receiued water receiued holie ghostno grace therfore put christ iesu paule heere iudgeth christian man iudgeth god doth measure iudge faithfull onelie outward signes inwarde thought heartes heines pcornelius centurionact receiued holie ghost baptised pthe gelded man queene candace beleeued therefore grace baptisedact obiection apostle beeing commaunded baptise name father name christ onelie none name beside wordes paule seruaunt iesus christ doe import paule seruant iesus christ onelie seruant god father holie ghost wordes paule spake vnto keeper beleeue lord iesu doe discharge beleeuing two person holie trinitie baptime infant note heere father made league god onelie themselues also posteritie god againe part promised would god onelie also seede post eritie wherefore lawfull circumcise child beeing yet infant like manner lawfull v baptise little one yet infant forasmuch also comprehended league haue thing selfe nothing let maie receiue signe manifestlie written deu chapter deu league made onelie present also absent yet borne pet mar vpon iudic fol concerning young child faith vnknowen v requisite partaker fruites sacrament verie likelie haue faith haue vse vnderstanding except god doe worke extraordinarilie appeareth v neuerthelesse cease communicate baptime first forasmuch cause baptime sometime circumcision called saint paule seale righteousnesserom faithge also expresse commaundement god male child marked eight daie secondlie speciall regard infant faithfull although haue faith effect haue age yet haue seede spring vertue promise receiued apprehended elder god promiseth v onelie godge beleeue also god ofspring seed yea vnto thousand degree last end therfore said saint paule child faithful sanctified mother wombe right title doe refuse giue marke ratification thing haue possesse alreadie alleadge yet although come faithful elder parent followeth ye number elect consequent sanctified god hath chosen child abraham isaacrom aunswere easie made true kingdome god borne faithfull parent good right leaue secret god iudge onelie knoweth yet notwithstanding wee presume stlie child god issued descended faithfull parent according promise forasmuch appeareth v contrarie according baptise young child faithful haue vsed done apostle time church god doubt god marke ioined praiers church assistaunt doth seale adoption election hath predestmate eternallie whether die come age discretion whether liue bring foorth fruites faith due time according meanes god hath ordeined beza place alleadged baptist actes act eunuche permitted baptised confession made faith pthe aunswere made thus done eunuche must drawen infant christian rashlie keepe baptime onelie obserued stra ngers religion full age affirme stranger church saith laie table set foorth bread meate god knewe expounding scripture knew breaking bread dionisius tooke bread blessed turned bodie supper onelie manner saie grace blesse meate antonius iulianus fasting first ye see gentile vncircumcised keeping lawe thinking thereon therefore must iustified faith came hearing glad tidings preached christ therefore must looke word luke beginning chapter saith workes faith receiue great free benefite god beleeue true workes neither beleeue neither discerne therfore ascribed vnto faith workes praier fasting holiest worke vnder heauen could saue christ neuer needed haue suffered greeuous paine vtterly died vaine neither god freelie chuse v workes chuse understande therefore workes called faith workes sprong faith god freelie gaue calleth saueth v good workes must man loue earnestnesse thereto bound without knowen whether verie christen knowe good tree good neuer felte fruite maie condition ascribe iustification saluation saith christ ye haue done ye doe ye vnprofitable seruaunts faith onelie receiue benefites christ beleeue alone hath deserued forgiuenesse sinnes world apostle heere first taught certified holie ghost conuersion gentile tindale corner stone plooke stone corrvption whence corruption commeth adam created corruption spoken heere purchased himselfe god found thing good made man therefore excellentest creature marred fashion till withdrawen himselfe god seperated himselfe fountaine righteousnesse coulde remaine vnto naughtinesse corruption thus wee see whence naughtinesse proceedeth ought blame god vice wherevnto subiect vnder helde prisoner according scripture saith wee bee solde vnder simie become bonde slaues satan wee must blame god must learne knowe heritage haue father adam therefore must take whole blame selues god c cal vpon iob fol covetovsnes couetousnesse maketh men doe couetousnesse roote euill tim couetousnesse image seruice col maketh men erre faith tim hath part kingdome christ god ephe hardened heart pharao faith miracle god could sinke made balaam knewe trueth god hate giue pestilent counsell taught false prophet olde testament interpret law god falslie c kept iudas vnbeliefe c compelled sell christ vnto scribe pharesies couetousnesse thing mercilesse couetousnesse made pharisies lye christ persecute falselie accuse made pilate though found innocent yet slaie caused herode persecute christ cradle maketh hypocrite persecute truth owne conscience c finallie couetousnes maketh manie truth pleaseth beginning cast vp againe afterwarde cruell enimies thereof ensample symon magus act tindale certeine ciuill lawe giuen vnto god vnto bound lawe euerie seauenth yeare thou shalt keepe free yeare iubelie yeare shall kept manner ought shall bee owing anie man either friend neighbour brother maie aske againe lord free yeare lord iubelie yeare yeare also called sabbatum terrae moses saieng vnto people wise sex annos agrum tuum c sixe yeares thou shalt sow thy land sixe yeares thou shalt cut thy vineyard gather fruite thereof seauenth yeare shall sabboth rest vnto land lord sabboth shall bee crop ground shall bring foorth owne kinde without thy labour shalt thou reape crop shall grow owne kinde thou shalt gather whie shall rotte vpon vine grasse corne vpon grounde grasse corne thou shalt reape grape thou shalt gather hoc est non tibi solo ea coacernabis neque repones federum tibi cum alijs commune vnto saie seauenth yeare non licet tibi debita exigere debt pardoned god commaundement consideration iubelie yeare couetous rich man next yeare following would require debtes poore neighbour bound vpon writing made call deede obligatorie saith esaie dissolue colligationes impiae c cancell thy wicked obligation loose vndoe heauie burthen oppresse thy neighbour dispatch let goe true wee must beware poison praie god preserue v men foolish sterue themselues forbeare eating drinking feare least foode poisoned skill meates discerne whether poisoned let v vnderstande lorde hath giuen v vse eares ende afraide receiue doctrine wee thinke high darke v behooueth v praie god giue v spirite discreation iudgement ende maie applie thing profite shall bee declared v woord shall bee laide vpon sande muddie myre vppon rocke sure stedfast grounde knowing otherwise labour cost commeth shortlie naught whilest either violence winde waues hudge floude doe rush house breake downe seeing right propertie substantial wise politike builder wonderfutl paradoxe inopinable sentence saye qui ipse fundauit c lorde himselfe fountaine hath founded whole earth hudge heauie thing vppon wauering water flowing floudes bee wordes prophet super maria fundauit eam super flumina preperauit eam saint hierome readeth super flumina stabiliuit eam upon sea hath founded whole earth vpon floudes hath stablished sentence cannot seeme iudgement men meruailous straunge wonderfull saieng earth founded vpon water naturall reason lead man say god hath founded sea vppon earth earth vpon water nam terra aqua stabilimentum est non aqua terrae foure element fire aire water earth orbe fire highest couereth earth round aire likewise ought natural cosent couer ye water round water earth wherefore followeth good reason earth beeing heauiest lowest foure element next vnder water ought therefore called foundation water water doe lie vpon earth water foundation earth reason strong naturall wit able impugne againe psalme prophet saith lorde hath founded earth vpon owne weight stablenesse fundasti terram super stabilitatem tuam non inclinabitur seculum seculi ouid poet saith like manner tellus poderatu librata suis earth staied paised meanes owne weight saith earth founded yet prophet saith dominus super maria fundauit orbem terrae super flumina stabiliuit eam lord hath founded whole earth vpon sea vppon floudes hee stablished yee shall vnderstand therefore order naturall reason earth like lowest foure element next vnder water ought altogether couered water vnderneath water ye almightie mightie creatour thing myraculous diuine power hath altered order generall hath made lawe statute peculiar water shall ouerflow whole earth contented portion earth dwell vpon get corner wise hardie head passe bound limit appointed statute made vppon third daie creation world reade gen chapter wise congregantur aqua sub coelo sunt locum vnum appareat arida let water vnder heauen gathered together one place drie lande maie appeare peculiar commaundement god philosopher beeing ignoraunt seeing miraculous worke aboue nature called natura particularis ye must note forasmuch peculiar order god hath established betweene water drie lande earth exalted aboue water euen farre walles house aboue foundation consideration miraculous worke god earth heere said ye prophet builded partlie vpon salt sea partlie vpon fresh floudes earth wonderfullie exalted euerie place aboue water euen far wall house aboue foundation water absolutelie foundation piller earth ric turnar earthqvake earthquake doe come earthquake shaking earth caused meanes winde exhalation inclosed within caues earth finde passage breake foorth el narrow waie cannot soone enough deliuered iustified c declared iust openlie knowne righteous like fruites good tree knowne good otherwise maie sentence interpreted could nothing foolish saieng iames man would thus interpret man obteineth remission sinne work worthie great benefit interpretation sticketh frowardlie vnderstandeth remissio sinnes coscience ought comforted seeth bringeth good work god sufficient please interpretation cleane contrarie open saiengs scripture teach remission sin commeth freely psalmist saith said wil acknowledge mine offencepsal accuse selfe vnto ye lord thou forgauest wickednes sin ro ye worketh beleeueth iustifieth vngodly faith cou ed righteousnes plainlie sinnes forgiue wicked vngodly man worketh anie work freely conclude ye gospel forgiue sin good work sake worthines diffe reth fro law saueth law trust wil suffice good wise touching bring nothing cause brawle chide wil neuer suffer themselues satisfied yet would contend ye number authority one place iames ouerthrowne wt many witness paule men wil vnderstand iustificatio al one thing therefore paule saith faith iustifieth vnderstand thereby faith causeth counted iust reputed righteous sin imputed vnto v forgiuen v christ sake iames saith work iustifie meaneth thus work declare v iust shew euidentlye righteous thus shalt thou make agree tindale ye shall vnderstand paule iames contrarie matter paule romanes galathians disputeth attributeth iustification good work iames reasoneth vtterlie condemne work therefore paule sheweth cause iustification iames effect paule declared iustified iames knowne iustified paule work excluded cause iustification iames approued effect proceeding thereof paule denied go iustified iames said followe iustified geneua ioine liu ly faith paule ye good work iames bring one life hast thou striken reason great hurtfull euill hand commonlie moued daungers far v seeme euen hand neither thing light small waight make v afraid wherefore feare diuine speaketh feare hath respect vnto sinne vnto wrath god vnto chastisement scourge finallie vnto hell fire noted two kinde feares2 feares one commonly called filiall pertaining naturall childe seruile pertaining bondman called seruile feare onelie feare paine hell fire either draweth v backe euill impelleth v well euen signified ethnike poethorace wrote oderunt peccare formidine poen wicked hate sinne feare punishment finall feare whereby men liue vpright flie wickednesse desire set foorth glorie god allow righteousnesse euen owne sake wherfore poet saith oderun peccare bo virtutis amore good hate sinne loue vertue c pet mar vpon rom fol difference feares peter feared otherwise iudas iudas indeede feared despaired peter feared gotte againe vnto christ denieng forsaken saie seruile feareseruile feare whereby abhorre god angrie flie vtterly void faith filial fearefiliall feare wherby ye midst terror lifted vp faith neither suffer selues swallowed vp feare wherfore godlie men feare neuer seioined faith thing knit together faith alwaies gouerneth fearefaith gouerneth feare shuld desperation wold easily succeed euen ye law ought alwaies ioined ye gospell also ought feare euer ioined faith imbrace ye gospell alwaies think vpo ye obediece ye comandemets god see often grieuously fal call selues back repetance contrariwise ye law receiued without gospell could neuer obey without christ also obtaine pardon offence committed pet mar vpon ro fol feare importeth feare importeth much life must ruled according god becommeth men know themselues subiect maker rush al naughtines know lust ye feare god raign v must acknowledge hath put v ye world liue libertie lust selues reserueth whole right ouer v must obey behold say word feare importeth say shuld lern direct whole life ye wil god c ca vp iob feare god wheras speak ye feare god haue vnderstand auish feare men term termed respect ye honour owe father master doe feare god certaine nothing honour whollie doe know must wise hath vttered wit maker maintaines e shewed fatherly goodnes towards v dutie ought child toward wil vtterlie vnthankful also behoueth v acknowledge dominio superioritie ouer v ye end euerie v yeld ng due honor may ern plese vnderstood flesh flesh vnderstoodrom though flesh onelie ye perteineth vnto vnchastitie paule calleth flesh heere christ doth iohn borne flesh wit whole man life soule bodie wit reason whatsoeuer doth within without al man studie world flesh c tindale deed ye law flesh shalbe iustifiedgal pflesh paule doth signifie ye schoolman dreame manifest grose sin vseth call proper name adulterie fornication vncleanenesse like flesh paule meaneth heere christ doth third chapter iohn borne flesh saith flesh flesh therefore signifieth whole nature man flesh saith iustified work lawe flesh therefore according paule signifieth righteousnesse wisdome deuotion religion vnderstanding possible naturall man man neuer righteous according reason lawe god yet righteousnesse work merit deuotion religion iustified c luther vpon gal fol borne flesh fleshiohn c pthat fleshlie wit wholie vncleane vnder wrath god therefore worde flesh signifieth corrupt nature man contrarie spirit man ingraffed christ grace holie ghost whose nature euerlasting immortall though strife flesh remaineth beza workes lawrom flesh shall iustified pflesh heere taken man manie place furthermore hath heere greater feare heere put shew contrarietie betweene god man would saie man nothing el peece flesh defil god purs perfect himselfe beza meaning place following shall haue trouble flesh1 co pby flesh vnderstandeth thing soeuer belongeth present life marriage bringeth manie discommodities bendeth sole life seruice agreeable god marriage b po hee would men void might giue themselues god onelie beza flesh neither doth saint paule place saithrom yee flesh meane anie thing lord gospell said vnto disciple ye world wherefore ambrose saith haue nature framed vnto v feele addeth moreouer wise men world flesh resist faith beleeue thing onelie agreeable reason place againe teacheth v ambrose name flesh vnderstandeth reason higher part soule saie therfore flesh according apostle meaning signifieth nothing el action ruled gouerned sense effect nature yet regenerate christ pet mar vpon rom fol againe place ye flesh cannot figuratiuelie interpreted vnderstand simply flesh truth would shew contrarie wherefore chrisostome vpon place saith thing verie daungerous alwaies vnderstande scripture according proper signification ye word meruaile therfore aduersaries meane much iangle make saie wordes lorde bodie spoken figuratiueliefiguratiuelie vnderstand page meane place filthie lust incontinencie flesh vnquietnesse fleshvnquietnesse flesh messenger satan vnderstandeth persecution trouble meanes stirring satan suffer continuallie gospells sake onelie open also false bretheren persecution trouble happened vnto praie vnto lord would deliuer affliction trouble flesh thus theodoretus ambrose also erasmus place plooke messenger plooke pricke flesh take thought flesh expounded take thought fleshrom fill lust pby flesh heere vnderstandeth naturall health bee neglected wee maie bee able constantlie serue god paule writeth timothie use little wine stomacke often heere hee prohibiteth onelie pleasure delight flesh wee lette loose bridle flesh made vnrulie wherefore seeing ought continuallie wrastle prone affect thereof lette v take heede ouer much delicatenesse nourish pet mar fol meaning place following flesh verelie meate bloud verelie drinke pwhen christ spake th se wordsiohn spake nothing sacrament instituted vntill last supper upon austen saith preparest thou either tooth bellie beleeue thou hast eaten christ sawe offended hee said vnto doth offende ye saie ye shall see sonne man ascending thether whence addeth saint austen shall know meant giue flesh eate teeth shall ascende whole christ addeth spirite quickeneth flesh profiteth nothing wordes speake spirite life saie saith austen spirituallie vnderstood christ saith flesh profiteth nothing meaning owne flesh austen saith meaneth profiteth vnderstood saie profiteth eaten doth much profite slaine shedding bloud wrath god father pacified sinnes forgiuen disciple followed himaugustin wer astonied abhorred word vnderstoode againe another place saith christ said except man eate flesh drinke bloud shall haue life vnderstood said hard saieng heare august sermo ad infan flesh shall inherit kingdome heauen flesh bloud cannot inherite kingdome heauen1 co pour beliefe shall generall resurrection flesh according scripture esaie rom iob iohn neuerthelesse shall purged corruption chaunged immortall life must vncorrupt flesh shall inherit kingdome god battaile betweene flesh spirite betweene flesh spirite continuall strife spirit ouercome temptation stronger flesh weaker flesh get custome spirite none oppressed though mountaine vpon hir backe sometime dreame thinke beare heauier milstone vpon breastes wee dreame would runne awaie feare legges seeme heauier lead euen spirit oppressed ouerladen flesh striueth gette vppe breake loose vaine till god mercie heareth grone iesus christ come loose power put crosse tribulation back flesh keepe downe minish hir strength mortifie tindale fol flesh spirite signifieth flesh spirite maist thou heere vnderstande flesh onelie perteineth vnto vnchastitie spirit inwardlie pertaineth vnto heart ut paule calleth flesh heere christ doth iohn borne flesh wit whole man life soule bodie wit reason whatsoeuer doth within without allflesh spirite man studie world flesh call flesh therefore whatsoeuer long without spirit god thinke speake god faith good workes spirituall matter call flesh also workes done without grace without working spirit god howsoeuer preach detestable doctrine three beginning good iust euill new testament contrarye olde denied resurrection body comparison betweene marcions doctrine pope marcions receiued man christen man except would refuse mariage pope receiueth priest except fors weare mariage diuersitie betweene heretikes pope heretikes doth except greater number pope doth speaketh generally thing one marcionites indgeth mariage vncleane sort doth pope sort farther marcion saith among christen men may temporall mariage conjunction must turned spirituall mariage selfe thing saith pope priest wherfore seeing graunt paule also holy father hath condemned heresie marcionites must needes followe opinion pope likewise damned heere obiect say eckius hath written pope doth condemne mariage causeth men alonely keep vowe aunswere first pope compelleth priest vowe fors weare mariage ther wer statute made afore ye pope priest shuld fors weare mariage shuld ther vowes made priest mariage thing shuld free vowe commeth pope decree prohibition decree vowe ergo prohibition goeth vowe wherefore euation haue place example emperour maketh statute man shall admitted seruice except first sweare enimie vnto king grace england emperour first enimie vnto king person also forbidder loue fauour towards king grace england thinke grace take acte none otherwise though doe cannot make men king enimies yet maketh appertaine vnto ye king enimies likewise pope though doe forbidde men mariage yet forbiddeth many priest yea admit man priest except first forswears mariage vowe first made priesthood bee giuen barnes notable paule saith1 tim vnus est mediator c ther one mediatour betweene god man christ iesus man upon place austen saith thus paulus non facet se mediatorem c paule maketh himselfe mediatour betweene god people requireth pray one beeing member bodie christ august contra epist perminiani li chap againe booke writeth thus saint iohn st iohannes ita dicerit c iohn would say haue written vnto ye sinne ye sin ye haue mediatour god intreate sinnes permenian heretike certeine place made bishop mediatour betweene god people good faithful christen man could abide would looke vpon apostle christ rather thinke antechrist tell womanchrisosto sith thou art sinfull wicked woman durst thou goe vnto know saith beholde wisdome woman shee prayeth vnto iames shee entreateth iohn goeth vnto peter get selfe mercie vpon haue neede aduocates god running gadding speake faire vnto although thou alone without aduocate praye vnto god thy selfe thou shalt obteine thy petition chrisostome sermon going forward gospell saint austen saithaugust li contra liar cap christen men doe mutally commende themselues praiers none maketh intercession onely true mediatour paule apostle though principall member vnder head yet member body christ knew greatest truest priest church entred figure inward place vaile heauen holinesse shadowishrom eternall commendeth also praiers faithfull neither doth make himselfe mediatour betweene people god praieth member bodie christ mutuallye praye member careful one another ye member yet trauailing earth1 co may ascend head gone heauen apeacement sinnes paule mediatour ye apostle also mediatours many mediatours neither paules owne reason stood fast sayd one god one mediatour betweene god menephe man christ also one keepe vnitie faith bonde peace againe another place thou seeke priest aboue heauens wher maketh intercession thee earth died thee yet dreame falleth downe father knee humble wise intreateth v vnderstand apostle ye appeareth face god vertue death auaileth perpetuall intercession v yet entered sanctuarie heauen vnto ende age worlde alone carrieth god prayer people abiding farre porch caluine instit booke chap sect brother saith saint austen haue iesus christ iust aduocate father propiciation sinnes held committed heresie held opinion committed scisme wherevppon scismes committed men doe saye iust wee doe make holye vncleane doe iustifie wicked doe desire doe obteine beseech way howe much past shame doe saye doe determine doe commaunde sayde iohn man doe sinne haue aduocate father iesus christ iust man saye doe saintes praye v doe bishoppes superintendentes pray people marke scripture see ouerseers also doe commend themselues people apostle saith people prayeng togethers v also apostle prayeth people people prayed apostle doe praie brother pray fo v also let al member pray together one let head make meanes saith augustine place word doth plainely openly attribute office intercession perteyneth chiefe priest none christ head againe writeth thus apostle shuld haue sayd thus write vnto intent yee sinne case anye man doe sinne haue mediatour father doe praye sinnes perminian one place doth make bishoppe mediatour betweene people god good faythfull christen folkes could abide wold esteeme apostle christ rather antichrist christen men commend themselues one praiers whome none doth intreate himselfe intreateth al true mediatour forasmuch figure resembled priest olde testament none sound euer prayed priest musculus fol man christ iesus alonebasil gaue himselfe raunsome al men sufficiet mediatour aduocate intercessour holy scripture teacheth diuers place whosoeeuer therefore refuseth pray vnto man christ iesus mediatour aduocate vnto god father flyeth without doubt enimie vnto christ vttermost power laboureth make christ vse say ia ke office since time ascention chiefe principall office intercessour mediatour aduocate plooke aduocate meeke meeke meekemat easilye prouoked iniuries euery offence wayward froward rather readie suffer anie thing bee lyke vnto wickedrom finally doe resist euill doe ouercome euill dooing good marl fol meeke shall pssesse earth blessed meekemat shall possesse earth pby earth vnderstand possesse worlde god keepe v wee bee soft meeke whatsoeuer arise yet patient abide end go side written psalme wicked shall bee weeded abide lord leasure shall inherit land againe opinion peter came rome second yeare claudius emperour dwelt yeares whose preaching rome brought faith christ eusebius saint hierome hath written say aunswered thuspeter neuer rome plaine christ suffered vppon crosse yeare tiberius emperour reigned yeares succeeded gaius reigned foure yeares followed claudius nowe peter came rome second yeare claudius must needes graunted peter came rome within yeares christes death againe side plaine wordes holy scripture paule onely conuerted fayth christ suffered vpon crosse appeareth also hee conuerted steuen stoned scripture plaine kept garmentes stoned steuen death paule himselfe writeth galathians came hierusalem yeares conuerted founde peter least yers death christ peter wer yet hierusalem yeares christ howe bee came rome second yeare claudius say yeare christ death furthermore peter hierusalem onely yeares death christ time also sent preach gospell romanes iewes beleeued preched gospell among iewes paule wrote romanes saluted greate manye name thought would haue saluted peter also hee bene chiefe bishop wherefore verie false lye papist historiograpers doe write peter first pope rome died bar och e saint hierome vpon power authoritie baptisme forgiue sinnes hath reserued onely himselfe saith ambrose part remoue stone graueambr de pen li ca preaching counsell exhortation lord worke raise vp dead lordes worke bring pitte ambassadouramb li epist messenger lord himselfe hath saued people lord remaineth alone man partner god forgiuing sin christ onely office hath taken away sinnes world yet priest office void power hath power commission open god paule saith speake vnto people2 cor euen person christtertul de baptismo tertulian saith chiefe priest say bishop hath right power giue baptime austen augustin saith god gaue ministerie remission sinnes vnto seruaunts power thereof retained vnto himselfe c iewel power god man thou couldest haue power meioh except giuen thee aboue pheere doe learne power god yea power darkenesse god causeth raigne sinnes disobedience word iob whosoeuer therefore resisteth power doth resist ordinaunce god purchaseth vnto himselfe vtter destruction vndoing let also magistrate predestination god meanes doth make child god bee made child diuells temple holy ghost temple diuells member christ member harlot rather predestination doth make child diuell made child god temple aunswere sith saith saint austen first manaugustin whole mankinde fall condempnation vessell made vnto ho n vessells owne righteousnesse mercy god made vessells dishonour ought bee imputed vnto anye vnrighteousnesse iniquitie vnto iudgement againe god doth recompense due punishment vnto doth reproue giueth vndeserued grace vnto whome hee doth choose de uered blame similitude creditour whose power swearing tell vnto friend saith iohn chrisostom thou pro te thy swearingchriso su thine aduersary shuld thinke thee sweare aright would neuer compell thee thinketh thee thereby become peri rer therefore enforceth thee oth seldome hath priuate oth good conclusion happely thou wilt say cannot ware vnlesse doe sweare debter beleeueth vnlesse make oth wherevnto aunswere rather content haue thy ware vnsolde loose thy money thy saluation christ reason faithfully conscience let thy soule deare vnto thee thy corruptible substaunce though thou loose part thy substance yet maist thou liue thou loose god thou canst liue greater reward shalt thou haue loosing feare god thou hadst giuen almes done paine loue lord requireth worthy crowne done without paine moreouer counsell thee friend saith chrisostome thou true christian thou neuer compell man sweare whether sweareth right wrong thou art without daunger afore god considering christ whose seruaunt thou oughtest hath giuen thee sore commaundement contrary beside though oth true yet thy conscience cleere periury much matter doubtfull vnto thee thou puttest daunger thereof false hast thou enforced periury lacke christen charitie
